full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 749 Filed 08/10/22 Page 2 of 236 LBUCmax1
1 THE COURT: Matters to take up?
2 MR. EVERDELL: Your Honor, from the defense, I think after Mr. Alessi, there is going to be a series of law enforcement agents to talk about items that were recovered during various searches, and I have some objections to the exhibits that I want to raise now, which we've conferred with the government, we've reached agreement on some things, but there are others to raise.
3 THE COURT: Okay.
4 MR. EVERDELL: The first witness -- and this relates to the Florida -- the search of the Palm Beach residence. I believe Mr. Parkinson, who I believe is going to testify after Mr. Alessi, is the agent who went through during the search, of October 20th of 2005, of that residence. He did the video walk-through of the residence. So there is video and he was present. I believe he's going to say he was present when photographs were taken of various rooms and things in the house. Those are going to be offered through him.
5 So there are three things to talk about here with Mr. Parkinson. There is the exhibits - the photographs - the video, and the certain testimony.
6 We'll start with the exhibits, the photographs. We already moved in limine to exclude one of the photographs, that was Government Exhibit 288. That was a photograph, if you recall, your Honor, of a younger girl sort
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300

EVERDELL: Your Honor, from the defense, I think after Mr. Alessi, there is going to be a series of law enforcement agents to talk about items that were recovered during various searches, and I have some objections to the exhibits that I want to raise now, which we've conferred with the government, we've reached agreement on some things, but there are others to raise.

I believe Mr. Parkinson, who I believe is going to testify after Mr. Alessi, is the agent who went through during the search, of October 20th of 2005, of that residence. Those are going to be offered through him.
